just one more question here, is this will be used internally by sairedis ? since i see you added  custom range port attributes, or this will interact with SAI via sairedis ?

> just one more question here, is this will be used internally by sairedis ? since i see you added custom range port attributes, or this will interact with SAI via sairedis ?

This will be used internally by sairedis, it will not interact with SAI. Basically swss will use these port attributes to set  the  link event damping config and link event damping algo (using sai_port_api->set_port_attribute() API) and these set requests will be consumed by sairedis internally to set the link event damping algo and config in the link event damping logic in syncd.
Why then this state needs to be held inside sairedis and not OA directly ?

> Why then this state needs to be held inside sairedis and not OA directly ?

There was couple of reasons:
- When link events are sent from syncd, there can be multiple listeners to these events notifications coming from syncd (today it is OA but in future other components can listen to these events too) and if OA is doing damping, other listeners will receive the undamped events from syncd.
- Keeping the damping logic in software stack as low as possible will reduce the number of notifications upper layer gets.
- Adding the damping in syncd holds the events before any applications can get them.

We discussed this during HLD review and syncd implementation had advantages over OA implementation.

cc: @bhagatgit @mikeberesford

You did not answered my questions about protected constructors

> You did not answered my questions about protected constructors

In another comment reply, I had added the explanation:

Strictly speaking constructor is not needed, but constructor was added as protected just to make it clear to clients that they cannot directly instantiate an object of the class.

Agree, this class still be uninstantiable because of the pure virtual method, but to put the emphasize on not trying to directly instantiate this class, protected constructor was kept.

I am inclined to keep constructor as:
protected:
SelectableEventHandler() = default;

Thank you.

this is the issue:
https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/compare/1761e2f721ecc5295898b457465cf3abc3adaf96...7f7a7587debf6b393118b29ca71c2d00722bb885#diff-8461e6438fb46cfa3d81a0760d680f8e5ac38c57da553a8f9add2fa3ffde3549R2500

Because of this change: [https://github.com/opencomputeproject/SAI/pull/1793/files#diff-8461e6438fb46cfa3d81a0760d680f8e5ac38c57da553a8f9add2fa3ffde3549R2500](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fopencomputeproject%2FSAI%2Fpull%2F1793%2Ffiles%23diff-8461e6438fb46cfa3d81a0760d680f8e5ac38c57da553a8f9add2fa3ffde3549R2500&data=05%7C01%7Ckcudnik%40microsoft.com%7C649c37e834a242edb07408dbb869fba5%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C638306537569037240%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Y%2F%2B6w2uqWCuQ1U1k6QHGWH2rg3Nsj84T4QEfSUpyhro%3D&reserved=0)

SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_SWITCH_ID will be required when switch type is FABRIC, and this is somewhat breaking change, since suddenly metadata in SAI v1.13 will require this attribute, and to make this work, sairedis needs to update SAI v1.13 on master, which I added PR here: [https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1292](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fsonic-net%2Fsonic-sairedis%2Fpull%2F1292&data=05%7C01%7Ckcudnik%40microsoft.com%7C649c37e834a242edb07408dbb869fba5%7C72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7C1%7C0%7C638306537569037240%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=I6AQ%2BAhaG7aedK6gaXf9yiCEL6uDIzO6ZHwF7DVY74o%3D&reserved=0) and it’s failing VOQ switch test, because metadata is requiring this attribute, and swss is not providing it

So solution to that is to merge sairedis with failing tests, and then update swss with PR that will also pass this attribute on FABRIC, then swss will pass, and then next PRs on sairedis will also pass

thi seems more like workaround, since maybe SAI lib is too slow ?

> thi seems more like workaround, since maybe SAI lib is too slow ?

Its not a problem with SAI library. When we enable ASAN, it adds additional overhead which slows down the process (almost 2x https://github.com/google/sanitizers/wiki/AddressSanitizerPerformanceNumbers). Hence it is required to increase the timeout for ASAN specific builds.

May I know why do we need this attribute in dualtor scenario?

> > Hello @bingwang-ms Can you please take a look? This PR is similar to #1188

> May I know why do we need this attribute in dualtor scenario?

Need to add additional MAC to VLAN interface on Mellanox SPC-1. It is impossible on SPC-1, so we just add this additional MAC to FDB table, so traffic forwarding will work.

SAI use this SAI_ADDITIONAL_MAC_ENABLED attribute to make changes per SPC.

why use extra SAI_REDIS_NOTIFY_SYNCD_INVOKE_DUMP enum instead of actually calling sai_dump api ? that would do exactly the same in more elegant way?

> why use extra SAI_REDIS_NOTIFY_SYNCD_INVOKE_DUMP enum instead of actually calling sai_dump api ? that would do exactly the same in more elegant way?

Hi Kamil. I believe you are referring to saisdkdump which also covers lower layer information. Currently only mellanox platforms collect this information and other vendors may not have implemented it. https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/blob/7a604c51671a85470db3d15aaa83b6b39a01531a/scripts/generate_dump#L1075
Other vendors invoke their own proprietary debug dump information as seen in the above generate_dump script. So there needs to be action taken by all vendors to standardize this.

On a note, this feature intends to collect dump immediately after SAI failure before services restart. In order to accommodate all vendors today we took the approach. Once all SAI vendors support the debug dump functionality we can standardize this.

This was also brought up during the HLD discussion and it was decided to take it in the SAI community meeting https://github.com/sonic-net/SONiC/pull/1212#issuecomment-1377827163
